diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Osmotic demyelination syndrome (ODS) and peripheral neuropathy from uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Ischemic stroke, hemorrhagic stroke, medication toxicity, alcohol intoxication, mercury intoxication, post-infectious viral cerebellitis, malignancy (paraneoplastic syndrome), vitamin deficiencies
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The MRI revealed symmetric signal abnormalities in the pons and cerebellum, which are characteristic of ODS. The patient's history of uncontrolled diabetes, symptoms of acute-onset ataxia and dysarthria, and negative tests for alternate causes supported the diagnosis. The severity of sensory impairment did not account for the ataxia, indicating a cerebellar component likely due to ODS from hyperosmolar state caused by diabetes.
